column4: the Ubuntu cd image is 690MB but I only have 650MB cd's..  is there anyway I could still do this, via some kind of compression?  I'm only 40mb away....
Unfortunately not.  You could, however, use the minimal CD, which is only 8mb.
what features would I lose?
You'd only lose the fact that you'd be forced to connect to the internet during the install (instead of afterwards) to download packages.
The installed system will be identical (also, it won't be a liveCD)
is something like that available for Intrepid Ibex yet?
where can I find that 8mb download?
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/intrepid/main/installer-i386/20080522ubuntu12/images/netboot/mini.iso  for intrepid.  Also, #ubuntu+1 is the place for intrepid support
that page has links to the other versions
so when all is completed it should be exactly the same as if I had used the LiveCD correct?
yes, the installed system will be the same
thank you :)
Actually, thats technically not true.  The minimal ISO will give you a fully updated system.  Which is the same as if you install the liveCD and then fully upgrade
u there?
You can also install the desktop edition, and then install server things.
you'll want the generic kernel, instead of the server kernel
wait.. so the server edition comes with things that the desktop edition does not come with?
All editions merely come with different default packages installed, you can convert from one to the other, etc, at will.
and how do I do that?  "you'll want the generic kernel, instead of the server kernel"?
well honestly, I think it would be simpler to start with the desktop and then add the server things.
well I don't want the server things at all, I just want the desktop.  But I only have 650mb CD's.
ah.  Use the minimal CD
very nice, thank you :)
